question: 97 for stony please?
answer:
“It’s not that easy”

-

Tony knew Rhodey was staring at him. 

Well. More accurately, Rhodey was staring at the little bulge in the front of his blazer, where the flip-phone was nestled firmly in the pocket. The same way it had been yesterday, and the day before that, and the day before that. The same way it had been for a year, now. 

Tony really had no idea why he hadn’t just shoved the thing into a drawer by now. It was ridiculous, and Steve quite clearly wasn’t going to call. That had never been a possibility, not really. It’d just been a precaution. A way to reach him in case the world started ending. Steve hadn’t left it with him to try and repair what had been broken. To be frank, Tony was certain the man simply didn’t care enough for that. 

And why he hell would he? He had Barnes, he had the rest of the team. There was no need for Tony to be in his life any more.

So really, Tony should throw the thing away.

But that didn’t mean he was going to, obviously. No matter how many stupid pitying looks his asshole best friend gave him. “Can you cut that out?” He snapped irritably, flapping a hand in Rhodey’s face and then turning away. “It’s very distracting.”

Rhodey sighed, grabbing the bottle of whiskey from Tony’s counter before he could get his fingers on it and then sliding it away. Tony glared at him. “It’s not healthy, you know.”

“What, the drinking? Because I’ve been doing that all my life, honeybunch, as you well know, so it’s not like I’m going to be stopping any time soon-”

“The way you carry that damn phone around like it’s a piece of Steve’s soul,” Rhodey interrupted, eyes moving back down to Tony’s jacket once more. “Business meetings, battles, morning runs- you never let it leave your side. But– but Tony, it’s not gonnna ring. You know it’s not.”

Tony stared at him, fisting his hand into his side and resisting the urge to just tell Rhodey to get the fuck out and leave him alone. He’d known the guy for too long to think that Rhodey would ever listen to an order like that. Instead, he turned away, pushing past him and reaching over to the Whiskey once more. His fingers popped the lid with ease and he poured a generous amount into his tumbler before throwing it all back in one. Behind him, Rhodey just sighed, 

Tony was exceptionally good at letting people down. 

“You’re gonna have to give up on him someday.” Rhodey murmured, voice gentle as he rested his hand on Tony’s shoulder. Tony looked down at the floor stubbornly, mouth pursed tight. He didn’t want to have this conversation. Not now, not ever

“It’s not that easy, pal,” he laughed bitterly and shook his head, focusing on the bite of the alcohol at the back of his throat instead of the one at the back of his eyes. 

“I know, I know, Tony, but you just have to-”

“-No, you don’t fucking get it,” Tony spun around and looked at him, shoving the hand off his shoulder and then pushing weakly at Rhodey’s chest, “you don’t understand what it’s like, to be that in love with someone and know they won’t ever fucking feel even a tenth of what you do. You’ve never had your heart ripped out of your fucking chest by the one person that all you ever wanted to do was trust, and then watch him turn and leave for someone else.” Tony sucked in a shaky breath, running a hand through his hair and then turning away before Rhodey could see the telltale sparkling behind his eyes. Not tonight. Not fucking tonight. 

“You don’t know what it’s like to get hurt, over and over and over again, and still be fucking pathetic enough to want to hold so desperately onto the last remaining piece of them. Because you’re not pathetic. You’re not a fucking idiot, not like me.”

He thought of those piercing blue eyes, smiling down at him across the breakfast table. The shared jokes and little touches that had sparked off a chain reaction across Tony’s skin every damned time. He remembered every screaming match they’d had, the ones at the very beginning when Tony had just wanted to kiss him until he shut his goddamned mouth, and then the ones later, when Tony had screamed himself hoarse because Steve was reckless and stupid and scared the shit out of him every time he threw himself into the line of fire. 

He’d always loved Steve, even when he’d hated him. But it had never been something that was reciprocated. At most, Tony would have been Steve’s halfway house. His ‘this is the best you can get for now’. 

That was all Tony ever would be, really. To Steve- to anyone. 

Rhodey opened his mouth to say something else, but Tony smacked a hand through the air and swallowed down the lump in his throat. His hand curled around the neck of the bottle as he swiped it off the table and began to back away. “Fuck off, Rhodey,” he said with a wave, “I have work to do. Feel free to take the couch, but don’t disturb me in there.”

He marched out of the room and shoved the bottle up to his lips, feeling it burn as it trickled down his throat. He pulled the phone out of his pocket and glared at it, thinking about throwing it against the wall, crushing it under his foot, beating the damn thing with a baseball bat. That’d probably be cathartic.

But that’s all they were. Thoughts. They would never turn into actions, and everyone knew it. Tony was just too fucking weak.

He smiled and wiped the errant tear off his face, chugging another mouthful of Whiskey. Who even cared, anyway? Not him. 

Nope. Not at all.

summary: Hey, how are you? Could you do a TonyxReader, numbers 48 and 56, please?
question: Hey, how are you? Could you do a TonyxReader, numbers 48 and 56, please?
answer:
I’ve been better, but thanks for asking, nonnie!
This can be seen as romantic or platonic and the reader is gender neutral. Warnings for angst and Howard Stark’s A++ parenting. I may or may not have used this to channel some hurt over my relationship with my own dad. Anyway, angst o’hoy! Hope you’ll like it!
 48 “Why are you crying?” & 56 “Tell me what’s wrong.”

       ~~~

     Small tufts of hair disappeared and reappeared between your fingers as you carded them through the umber mane on top of Tony’s head. Silken, so silken.

     The tears had dried in the corners of his eyes, leaving salt and sand on his skin.

     You put your nose between the strands, down close to his scalp, breathing him in and relishing in the sleepy heat radiating from somewhere deep.

     He snuffled a little at the contact, burrowing his head closer to your chest. He had been asleep only for a little while, but you were content with letting him use you as a pillow for a bit-  he needed the rest.

     You’d found him just a couple of hours earlier in his workshop, hands clamped tightly over his ears, eyes squeezed shut and a broken howl lingering on his lips, waiting to spill out. Careful not to spook him, you’d proceeded with caution, asking Jarvis to lower the music to alert the man of your presence -  you knew from experience that physical contact as a way of announcing your company was a no go.

     When he’d finally looked up there’d been arid anguish behind the wetness in his eyes, something dry and broken. He didn’t even try to brush it off or wipe those tears when he caught you staring; he’d just looked empty -  haunted.

     “Tony.. why are you crying?” the line between soft sounding and what Tony would interpret as condescending was thin, but dammit if you weren’t gonna walk it, “tell me what’s wrong.”

     No words, no way of verbal explanation or answer. He just deflated and swiped over the hologram behind him, and a video started to play. It looked old, like a home movie. The smiling face of who you recognised as Tony’s mother appeared, she waved off whoever was holding the camera with a patient smile.

     “Oh, enough with that!”

     In the background something clattered loudly, like glass against hardwood floors.

     “Is that..?”

     Tony nodded.

     A clearly intoxicated Howard Stark briefly came into view.

     The owner of the camera clearly tried to keep the focus on Maria and the cake she was putting the last touches on but there was no blocking out the raised and slightly slurred voice coming from the other room which was barely visible in the frame. Maria’s smile didn’t falter but it attained a certain level of strain.

     “What?!…No, no Tony I- ..yeah yeah, super, whatever. Just go.. Maria! Maria!”

     She gave the camera an apologetic glance before wiping her hands on a towel and hurrying over to her husband; a moment later she came back with a small Tony on her hip. He couldn’t have been more than five.

     “You want to help me decorate the cake?”

     Tony looked sad but smiled at his mother, nodding.

     The image got slightly static and then died down.

     “Later that night when he thought I was asleep he came into my room, told me what an absolute asshole he was and how I was too, can a five year old even be an asshole? Anyway, he kept saying these things, that we were the same him and me, just as mean, just as prone to hurt everyone we love, just as bad. He told me I was a bad seed, because that’s what he was, and that he had never been able to lose that, and neither would I. He thought I was asleep, but I heard every word. And that’s when I knew.”

     You swallowed down the wave of emotion clawing in your throat, and reached out and layed a tentative hand on his shoulder, squeezing.

     “Knew what?”

     “That he hated me. That he always would, because he saw himself in me and since he hated himself..well.. anyhow- I had forgotten about that night, or actually I’d probably suppressed it.. til I found this in dear old dad’s old files.”

    “Whatever he said, whatever he did, whatever he was. That was on him. Your father is not a reflection of you.”

     You had been so careful after that, touching him only with the softest touches you could find, afraid of breaking this fragile trust he had confided in you. He hadn’t said much himself, just allowed you to try to envelop him in some kind of comfort, absorbing whatever you’d give him like a man starved for breath.

     Eventually you had gotten him to loosen up enough to follow you to the couch with the promise of Empire strikes back and no talking.

     You had held out your arm in invitation. At the hesitant look in Tony’s eyes you’d just sighed and offered a sly smile.

     “I won’t tell anyone if you won’t.”

     And that had thankfully, blissfully, brought a chuckle to his full somber lips.

     Now the credits were rolling and Tony was busy creating soft sleeping noises against your stomach, making you giggle lightly at the way he made deeply displeased noises even in his sleep any time you stopped petting him.

     The two of you had known each other for quite some time; still, the times he showed himself vulnerable and open like this were few and far in between.

    You gently stroked his cheek, letting the pads of your fingers trace over the skin coarse with stubble and dried tears. He looked so different like this; soft; open; young - It caused your heart to bloom in a beautiful ache.
answer_abstract:
I’ve been better, but thanks for asking, nonnie!
This can be seen as romantic or platonic and the reader is gender neutral. Warnings for angst and Howard Stark’s A++ parenting. I may or may not have used this to channel some hurt over my relationship with my own dad. Anyway, angst o’hoy! Hope you’ll like it!
 48 “Why are you crying?” & 56 “Tell me what’s wrong.”

       ~~~

     Small tufts of hair disappeared and reappeared between your fingers as you carded them through the umber mane on top of Tony’s head. Silken, so silken.

     The tears had dried in the corners of his eyes, leaving salt and sand on his skin.

     You put your nose between the strands, down close to his scalp, breathing him in and relishing in the sleepy heat radiating from somewhere deep.

     He snuffled a little at the contact, burrowing his head closer to your chest. He had been asleep only for a little while, but you were content with letting him use you as a pillow for a bit-  he needed the rest.

summary: Stephen: You know what's funny? I always seem to remember things about other people, but forget things about myself. Tony: Like...
body:
Stephen: You know what’s funny? I always seem to remember things about other people, but forget things about myself.

Tony: Like what?

Stephen: Once I forgot my own last name.

Tony: Just use mine next time someone asks.

Stephen: Yeah, okay- wait!!

body:
3 AM Confession

Anon asked: “Hey if you are still taking requests, please Steve/Tony #93 💖 Keep on writing”
A/N: I tried my best, Anon. Hope you enjoy it!Summary: #93, “Your heart is pounding.” Tony always feels his heart pound out of his chest when Steve walks in the room, and smiles at him. Steve never notices, until he does. Pairing(s): Steve/Tony

Whenever Steve walks in the room, Tony can’t help but look at him and grin like a loon. His heart beats faster, and Tony thinks Steve can actually hear his heart pounding every time. If he can, he never says anything about it, just keeps talking about whatever subject they had been discussing, and Tony follows his lead. He never asks Steve if he can hear Tony’s heart, doesn’t want to put it out in the open. He’s too scared of being rejected by the Super Soldier, too scared of ruining what they have because of feelings that probably aren’t returned.

Steve’s jerked from sleep when he hears FRIDAY speak. It’s 3:00 in the morning, and the AI informs him that Tony is passed out in his lab. Sighing, he makes his way down to Tony’s personal lab and heads in, finding that Tony is, indeed, asleep at his desk with his face pressed against the surface of the table. Steve smiles softly and pulls the man to his feet, pulling him close to his own body so he doesn’t fall. It jostles Tony enough to wake him, and he meets Steve’s eyes then looks down at where his chest is pressed against Steve’s. Steve frowns, because he can feel the rythmic beat of Tony’s heart quicken so rapidly Steve is worried something is wrong. And then he looks at Tony and Tony looks at him, so he whispers softly as he begins pulling Tony upstairs to the penthouse and to his room. “Your heart is pounding, Tony.” Tony nods slightly, still half asleep, and his head drops to rest against Steve’s shoulder as he mumbles. “It’s your fault.”

Steve looks down at him in surprise. “What?” Tony looks up at him and yawns, and it’s clear that he has no filter from his brain to his mouth due to exhaustion. “You and your perfect smile and laugh. You’re too cute for your own good, you know that?” Steve smiles gently and resumes leading Tony to his room as he replies, “Thank you, Tony. I think you’re pretty cute yourself.” As they make it to Tony’s room, the man reaches up to kiss Steve’s cheek before patting it, yawning widely, and flopping face first onto the bed, snoring lightly. Steve blinks, then chuckles, and walks back to his room, touching his cheek lightly as he goes.

When Tony wakes up the next afternoon, after a well deserved 7 hours of sleep, he groans as the memories of Steve helping him to bed coming flooding to the front of his mind. He called Steve cute. He kissed Steve. Steve called him cute. Tony groans again, because he knows Steve is going to make him sit down and talk about it. He showers and changes into clean clothes, then opens his door with the intention of going out to the kitchen to eat, when he comes face to face with Steve. Steve frowns, because he can feel the rythmic beat of Tony’s heart quicken so rapidly Steve is worried something is wrong. And then he looks at Tony and Tony looks at him, so he whispers softly as he begins pulling Tony upstairs to the penthouse and to his room. “Your heart is pounding, Tony.” Tony nods slightly, still half asleep, and his head drops to rest against Steve’s shoulder as he mumbles. “It’s your fault.”

summary: Tony missed his #ScienceBro so much that when he was in the middle of fighting Maw with the nanotechnology suit and Bruce asked...
body:
Tony missed his #ScienceBro so much that when he was in the middle of fighting Maw with the nanotechnology suit and Bruce asked “Where’d that come from?” Tony turned around and excitedly ask if Bruce liked it.

Tony wanted to know if his Science Bro approved of his new tech. That is SO pure.

Like I just picture Tony designing new suits and tech and thinking “If only Bruce was here.”

summary: What it is, What we are or (basically a Tony Stark/Peter Parker writing prompt)
title: What it is, What we are or (basically a Tony Stark/Peter Parker writing prompt)
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2IOcTNa

by quotelover221b

It’s been 4 years since the fight with Thanos and Peter Parker is now around 21. He is dealing with being the sole hero of New York but dealing with villains like Venom is not his only problem. His personal life is a mess, he has to sort through staggering student loans and with May being sick he can’t been keep up with the bills of daily life. All the while he has to deal with the abandonment of his childhood heroes most especially Tony Stark. Now that’s another issue, when Tony left with Pepper he took a piece of Peter heart with him.
Just as Peter is getting a handle on things, the Avengers show back up in New York City including Tony. The team is impressed with him, he’s not impressed with them. With their return the Avengers have to deal with a new array of villains, a city that doesn’t believe in them and a hero who doesn’t trust them. Tony comes the realization that he has been slowly falling in love with a certain spider who wants nothing to do with him. Will Spiderman accept the Avengers back into the city he fought so hard to protect? Will Tony and Peter come to terms with the feeling they have for one another.
This is a writing prompt for anyone who wants to pick it up. There are more details inside.

title: What it is, What we are or (basically a Tony Stark/Peter Parker writing prompt)
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2IOcTNa

by quotelover221b

It’s been 4 years since the fight with Thanos and Peter Parker is now around 21. He is dealing with being the sole hero of New York but dealing with villains like Venom is not his only problem. His personal life is a mess, he has to sort through staggering student loans and with May being sick he can’t been keep up with the bills of daily life. All the while he has to deal with the abandonment of his childhood heroes most especially Tony Stark. Now that’s another issue, when Tony left with Pepper he took a piece of Peter heart with him.
Just as Peter is getting a handle on things, the Avengers show back up in New York City including Tony. The team is impressed with him, he’s not impressed with them. With their return the Avengers have to deal with a new array of villains, a city that doesn’t believe in them and a hero who doesn’t trust them. Tony comes the realization that he has been slowly falling in love with a certain spider who wants nothing to do with him. Will Spiderman accept the Avengers back into the city he fought so hard to protect? Will Tony and Peter come to terms with the feeling they have for one another.
This is a writing prompt for anyone who wants to pick it up. There are more details inside.
